policies.desc: The powers and extent of our navy.

options.desc: A fleet comprised entirely of corvettes from the merchant marine for handling space fauna and pirates.
options.description: the fleet should be comprised entirely of corvettes from the merchant marine
the fleet should be a modern navy without restrictions

options.desc: A fleet that is a civilization unto itself. Untold millions will live and die aboard our navy vessels.
options.description: the fleet should be a civilization unto itself. Untold millions will live and die aboard our navy vessels

policies.desc: The powers and extent of our army.

options.desc: A modern armu without restrictions. Allows building offensive armies.
options.description: our army should be modern and without restriction

options.desc: An army that is a civilization unto itself. Untold millions live and die in defense of our soil.
options.description: our army should be a cilivization unto itself

policies.desc: The structure of our colonial holdings.

options.desc: Colonial administration based off crude pre-ftl techniques of supporting the center at the expense of the periphery. Prevents upgrading Colonial Shelters and building non-resource extraction buildings and districts on planets other than the capital.
options.description: extrastellar planetary holdings should be governed like colonies

options.desc: A modern system of bureaucratic measures to enfranchise, incorporate, govern, and tax holdings.
options.description: our empire should enfranchise, enfranchise, incorporate, govern, and tax holdings rather than govern them as colonies

policies.desc: Our governmental powers and the abilities of factions within our empire.

options.desc: Political organization styled after pre-FTL, mono-planetary representation.
options.description: the political organization of our pre-FTL days suffices

options.desc: Modern political involvement for handling activism and propoganda.
options.description: we should embrace a modern interstellar political system

factions.desc: wish to preserve the systems and ideals of our pre-ftl past. They oppose modernization efforts, particularly those opposed to our governing ethics. The more modern buildings and colonies we create, the more elusive this past will become.

see the final frontier with a mix of hope and anxiety. What alien threats might await us? Will they gobble up all the good star systems? We must assume that any formal diplomacy will only serve to restrict our potential while the political landscape is still nascent.
believe that the creation of a galactic bureuacracy is a matter of national security.
believe that the fruits of empire should be enjoyed by our primary species alone.
believe that if xenos were to discover us it would bring our instant annihilation, such is there unknowable malice.
believe that is our duty to enlighten the benighted galaxy with our shining ideals.
